thread.title: Kevin Pietersen slams Cricket Australia – Sporting News
thread.title_full: Kevin Pietersen slams Cricket Australia – Sporting News

author: admin
title: Kevin Pietersen slams Cricket Australia – Sporting News
text:
CRICKET January 20, 2017 4:12pm EST January 20, 2017 4:12pm EST Former England batsman Kevin Pietersen has unloaded on Cricket Australia as his Melbourne Stars enter Saturday’s pivotal Big Bash League clash against the Sydney Sixers without five players due to international commitments. Sporting News 
Published on Jan. 20, 2017 
Jan. 20, 2017 
Former England batsman Kevin Pietersen has unloaded on Cricket Australia as his Melbourne Stars enter Saturday’s pivotal Big Bash League clash against the Sydney Sixers without five players due to international commitments. 
MORE: WATCH: Renegades keep semi-final hopes alive | 
Glenn Maxwell, James Faulkner and Adam Zampa, Marcus Stoinis and Pete Handscomb are the unavailable players due to their commitments with the Australian ODI sqaud. 
Pietersen this week urged administrators to stop scheduling ODIs in the same window as the BBL to ensure the best crickets can play in the domestic Twenty20 comp. 
And the outspoken batsman and popular commentator didn’t soften his stance on the eve of Saturday’s clash, with a win almost certain to hand the Stars a home semi-final. 
“I just find it bitterly disappointing that a guy can’t play in a fixture for us, which is a big fixture, to be sitting in a hotel room,” Pietersen told News Limited . 
“I flew to Bloemfontein in South Africa in between two Test matches a couple of months ago to actually play. 
“Stoinis might not even play (for Australia tomorrow). 
“He certainly would (play for the Stars) and I find it bitterly disappointing that he can’t play for the Stars. 
“We were told he was going to play and now he’s been pulled out of our set up. 
“I don’t understand the reasons, I find it strange and on a personal level I’m disappointed.”
